Oct 15, 2002

Why Congressional Web Sites Are (Usually) Worthless – It isn’t just Senate ethics rules. By Timothy Noah

> “Click today on the Web page of a U.S. representative, and you’ll typically find little more information than you’ll find on the gagged Web page of a U.S. senator. That’s because both houses of Congress are reluctant to let information flow through the Internet.” Slate
